001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils;
004import org.apache.commons.text.StringEscapeUtils;
005
006import java.io.File;
007import java.io.FileInputStream;
008import java.io.IOException;
009import java.io.InputStream;
010import java.net.URL;
011import java.util.Map;
012import java.util.NavigableMap;
013import java.util.Objects;
014import java.util.Properties;
015import java.util.stream.Stream;
016
017import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreStreamUtils.nameValue;
018import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreStreamUtils.sortedMap;
019
020/**
021 * Utility-class that simplifies the access to the content of any properties-files at file-system or in classpath.
022 */
023public class PropertiesUtils {
024
025    /**
026     * @param propsFile the properties-file to load from file-system
027     * @return the loaded properties as {@link NavigableMap sorted-map}
028     */
029    public static NavigableMap<String, String> propsMapFromFile(File propsFile) {
030        return sortedMap(propEntriesFromFile(propsFile));
031    }
032
033    /**
034     * @param propsResourcePath the path to properties-file in classpath
035     * @return the loaded properties as {@link NavigableMap sorted-map}
036     */
037    public static NavigableMap<String, String> propsMapResource(String propsResourcePath) {
038        return sortedMap(propEntriesResource(propsResourcePath));
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * @param propsURL {@link URL} to properties-file
043     * @return the loaded properties as {@link NavigableMap sorted-map}
044     */
045    public static NavigableMap<String, String> propsMapFromURL(URL propsURL) {
046        return sortedMap(propEntriesFromURL(propsURL));
047    }
048
049    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
050
051    public static Stream<Map.Entry<String, String>> propEntriesFromFile(File propsFile) {
052        try (InputStream propsInputStream = new FileInputStream(propsFile)) {
053            Properties props = new Properties();
054            props.load(propsInputStream);
055            return props.entrySet().stream().map(PropertiesUtils::propEntry);
056        } catch (IOException ex) {
057            return Stream.empty();
058        }
059    }
060
061    public static Stream<Map.Entry<String, String>> propEntriesResource(String propsResourcePath) {
062        try {
063            return propEntriesFromURL(IOUtils.resourceToURL(propsResourcePath));
064        } catch (IOException ex) {
065            return Stream.empty();
066        }
067    }
068
069    public static Stream<Map.Entry<String, String>> propEntriesFromURL(URL propsURL) {
070        try (InputStream propsInputStream = propsURL.openStream()) {
071            Properties props = new Properties();
072            props.load(propsInputStream);
073            return props.entrySet().stream().map(PropertiesUtils::propEntry);
074        } catch (IOException ex) {
075            return Stream.empty();
076        }
077    }
078
079    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
080
081    /**
082     * The same as {@link #propEntry(Map.Entry)}, but the values of properties
083     * are escaped with {@link StringEscapeUtils#escapeJava(String)}, which is very useful
084     * and convenient when the content of the result map is going to be represented as JSON or YAML,
085     * but some values like {@link System#lineSeparator()} requires to be escaped.
086     *
087     * @param entry the entry of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;Object,Object&gt;}
088     * @return an instance of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;String,String&gt;}
089     */
090    public static Map.Entry<String, String> propEntryEsc(Map.Entry<?,?> entry) {
091        return propEntryEsc(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * The same as {@link #propEntry(Object, Object)}, but the values of properties
096     * are escaped with {@link StringEscapeUtils#escapeJava(String)}, which is very useful
097     * and convenient when the content of the result map is going to be represented as JSON or YAML,
098     * but some values like {@link System#lineSeparator()} requires to be escaped.
099     *
100     * @param propName name of property as {@link Object} (the legacy of no generics in {@link Properties}-class)
101     * @param propValue value of property as {@link Object} (the legacy of no generics in {@link Properties}-class)
102     * @return an instance of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;String,String&gt;}
103     */
104    public static Map.Entry<String, String> propEntryEsc(Object propName, Object propValue) {
105        return nameValue(
106            Objects.toString(propName),
107            StringEscapeUtils.escapeJava(Objects.toString(propValue))
108        );
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * Transforms the entry of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;Object,Object&gt;}
113     * into the entry of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;String,String&gt;}
114     * with use of standard transformation via {@link Objects#toString(Object)}
115     *
116     * @param entry the entry of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;Object,Object&gt;}
117     * @return the entry of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;String,String&gt;}
118     */
119    public static Map.Entry<String, String> propEntry(Map.Entry<?,?> entry) {
120        return propEntry(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * A factory-method produce an instance of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;String,String&gt;}
125     *
126     * @param propName name of property as {@link Object} (the legacy of no generics in {@link Properties}-class)
127     * @param propValue value of property as {@link Object} (the legacy of no generics in {@link Properties}-class)
128     * @return an instance of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;String,String&gt;}
129     */
130    public static Map.Entry<String, String> propEntry(Object propName, Object propValue) {
131        return nameValue(
132            Objects.toString(propName),
133            Objects.toString(propValue)
134        );
135    }
136
137    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
138
139    private PropertiesUtils() {
140        // prohibit the creation of utility-class instance
141        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot instantiate utility-class " + getClass().getName());
142    }
143}
